<<<<<<< HEAD
The conspiracie, and tragedie of Charles Duke of Byron, Marshall of France Acted lately in two playes, at the Black-Friers. Writted by George Chapman. Chapman, George, 1559?-1634.
[132] p.
Printed by G. Eld for Thomas Thorppe, and are to be sold [by Laurence Lisle] at the Tygers head in Paules Church-yard, [London] : 1608.
In verse. The first word of the title is xylographic. Bookseller's name from STC. Signatures: [A]² B-R⁴. The last leaf is blank. "The tragedie of Charles Duke of Byron" has separate divisional title; register is continuous. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

"The tragedie of Charles Duke of Byron" has separate divisional title; register is continuous. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
